title: Baseline Characteristics Table
text: baseline characteristic analysis aims provide tables summarize details participants. development baseline characteristic analysis involves functions: prepare_base_char: prepare analysis raw datasets. format_base_char: prepare analysis outdata proper format. rtf_base_char: transfer output dataset RTF table.

what: Create Baseline Characteristic Table for Subgroup Analysis
title: Baseline Characteristics Table
text: baseline characteristic subgroup analysis aims provide tables summarize details participants subgroup. development baseline characteristic subgroup analysis involves functions: prepare_base_char_subgroup(): prepare analysis raw datasets. format_base_char_subgroup(): prepare analysis outdata proper format. rtf_base_char_subgroup(): transfer output dataset RTF table.

previous_headings: Create Baseline Characteristic Table for Subgroup Analysis
title: Baseline Characteristics Table
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl adsl$TRTA <- adsl$TRT01A adsl$TRTA <- factor(   adsl$TRTA,   levels = c("Placebo", "Xanomeline Low Dose", "Xanomeline High Dose"),   labels = c("Placebo", "Low Dose", "High Dose") ) plan <- plan(   analysis = "base_char_subgroup",   population = "apat",   observation = "apat",   parameter = "age;gender;race" ) meta <- meta_adam(   population = adsl,   observation = adsl ) |>   define_plan(plan = plan) |>   define_population(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(SAFFL == "Y"),     var = c("USUBJID", "TRTA", "SAFFL", "AGEGR1", "SEX", "RACE")   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "age",     var = "AGE",     label = "Age (years)",     vargroup = "AGEGR1"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "race",     var = "RACE",     label = "Race"   ) |>   define_analysis(     name = "base_char_subgroup",     title = "Participant by Age Category and Sex",     label = "baseline characteristic sub group table"   ) |>   meta_build() ## title: Baseline Characteristics Table
text: input function prepare_base_char_subgroup() meta object created metalite package. output function outdata object containing list analysis raw datasets. Key arguments : subgroup_var: character value subgroup variable name observation data saved meta$data_observation. subgroup_header: character vector column header hierarchy. first element first level header second element second level header. output dataset contains commonly used statistics within subgroup_var. information subgroup saved outdata$group outdata$subgroup. n_pop: participants population within subgroup_var.

title: Exposure Duration Table
text: exposure duration analysis aims provide table summarize identified duration category. development exposure duration analysis involves functions: meta_sl_exposure_example: build metadata (meta object) analysis. prepare_exp_duration: prepare analysis raw datasets. format_exp_duration: prepare analysis outdata proper format. rtf_exp_duration: transfer (mock) output dataset RTF table.

title: Exposure Duration Table
text: two steps meta_sl_exposure_example function order build metadata (meta object): processing ADaM dataset save meta information &R reporting. Step1: ADEXSUM, ADaM dataset Drug Exposrue Summary Data, utilized : Sum duration STUDYID SITENUM USUBJID SUBJID APERIOD EXTRT ADOSEFRM PARAMCD. Subset exposure data upcase(trim(left(paramcd))) = "TRTDUR". Get exposure duration adexsum$AVAL participants. Assign duration category adexsum$EXDURGR .e.”>=1 day”, “>=7 days”,“>=28 days”, “>=12 weeks” “>=24 weeks”. Step2: Save analysis plan metadata(parameter analysis) information, build meta object.
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl adexsum <- data.frame(USUBJID = adsl$USUBJID) adexsum$TRTA <- factor(adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Placebo", "Xanomeline Low Dose", "Xanomeline High Dose"),   labels = c("Placebo", "Low Dose", "High Dose") )  adexsum$APERIODC <- "Base" adexsum$APERIOD <- 1  set.seed(123) # Set a seed for reproducibility adexsum$AVAL <- sample(x = 0:(24 * 7), size = length(adexsum$USUBJID), replace = TRUE) adexsum$EXDURGR <- "not treated" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 1] <- ">=1 day" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 7] <- ">=7 days" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 28] <- ">=28 days" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 12 * 7] <- ">=12 weeks" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 24 * 7] <- ">=24 weeks"  adexsum$EXDURGR <- factor(adexsum$EXDURGR,   levels = c("not treated", ">=1 day", ">=7 days", ">=28 days", ">=12 weeks", ">=24 weeks") ) unique(adexsum$EXDURGR) ## [1] >=12 weeks  >=7 days    >=28 days   >=1 day     >=24 weeks  not treated ## Levels: not treated >=1 day >=7 days >=28 days >=12 weeks >=24 weeks plan <- metalite::plan(   analysis = "exp_dur", population = "apat",   observation = "apat", parameter = "expdur" )  meta <- metalite::meta_adam(   population = adexsum,   observation = adexsum ) |>   metalite::define_plan(plan) |>   metalite::define_population(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(APERIOD == 1 & AVAL > 0)   ) |>   metalite::define_parameter(     name = "expdur",     var = "AVAL",     label = "Exposure Duration (Days)",     vargroup = "EXDURGR"   ) |>   metalite::define_analysis(     name = "exp_dur",     title = "Summary of Exposure Duration",     label = "exposure duration table"   ) |>   metalite::meta_build()

title: exposure-duration-histogram
text: plotly_exp_duration() function provides interactive visualization subject-level exposure duration clinical trials. histogram helps assess long participants remained treatment, configurable duration categories “≥1 day”, “≥7 days”, “≥28 days”, . Using pre-processed output prepare_exp_duration() (optionally extend_exp_duration()), plotly_exp_duration() generates intuitive, browser-based plot built Plotly. Users can customize display type (e.g., counts proportions), color, tooltip summary statistics, axis labels. meta_sl_exposure_example: create example exposure metadata (meta object) demonstration testing purposes. prepare_exp_duration: process subject-level exposure data calculate treatment duration prepare analysis. extend_exp_duration: categorize duration user-defined time windows (e.g., ≥7 days, ≥12 weeks) add group-level summaries. plotly_exp_duration: generate interactive histogram plot visualize exposure duration distribution across subjects treatment arms.

Subset exposure data upcase(trim(left(paramcd))) = "TRTDUR". Get exposure duration adexsum$AVAL participants. Assign duration category adexsum$EXDURGR .e.”>=1 day”, “>=7 days”,“>=28 days”, “>=12 weeks” “>=24 weeks”. Step2: Save analysis plan metadata(parameter analysis) information, build meta object.
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl adexsum <- data.frame(USUBJID = adsl$USUBJID) adexsum$TRTA <- factor(adsl$TRT01A,   levels = c("Placebo", "Xanomeline Low Dose", "Xanomeline High Dose"),   labels = c("Placebo", "Low Dose", "High Dose") )  adexsum$APERIODC <- "Base" adexsum$APERIOD <- 1  set.seed(123) # Set a seed for reproducibility adexsum$AVAL <- sample(x = 0:(24 * 7), size = length(adexsum$USUBJID), replace = TRUE) adexsum$EXDURGR <- "not treated" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 1] <- ">=1 day" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 7] <- ">=7 days" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 28] <- ">=28 days" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 12 * 7] <- ">=12 weeks" adexsum$EXDURGR[adexsum$AVAL >= 24 * 7] <- ">=24 weeks"  adexsum$EXDURGR <- factor(adexsum$EXDURGR,   levels = c("not treated", ">=1 day", ">=7 days", ">=28 days", ">=12 weeks", ">=24 weeks") ) unique(adexsum$EXDURGR) #> [1] >=12 weeks  >=7 days    >=28 days   >=1 day     >=24 weeks  not treated #> Levels: not treated >=1 day >=7 days >=28 days >=12 weeks >=24 weeks plan <- metalite::plan(   analysis = "exp_dur", population = "apat",   observation = "apat", parameter = "expdur" )  meta <- metalite::meta_adam(   population = adexsum,   observation = adexsum ) |>   metalite::define_plan(plan) |>   metalite::define_population(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(APERIOD == 1 & AVAL > 0)   ) |>   metalite::define_parameter(     name = "expdur",     var = "AVAL",     label = "Exposure Duration (Days)",     vargroup = "EXDURGR"   ) |>   metalite::define_analysis(     name = "exp_dur",     title = "Summary of Exposure Duration",     label = "exposure duration table"   ) |>   metalite::meta_build()

title: exposure-duration-histogram
text: function takes fully prepared outdata steps simply visualizes pre-calculated statistics interactive way. reshapes counts proportions tables wide long format, row corresponds specific combination : Exposure duration category (e.g., >=7 days). Treatment group (e.g., Placebo). uses reshaped tables create stacked bar charts grouped bar charts show: number proportion participants exposure duration category treatment group. also uses summary statistics (char_stat_groups) create hover text shows detailed statistics bar (.e., treatment group × exposure duration category). interactive dropdown lets switch different views (e.g., cumulative exposure duration, exclusive categories, horizontal bars).

title: Build an Interactive Baseline Characteristic Table
text: code meta_sl_example().
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl adsl$TRTA <- adsl$TRT01A adsl$TRTA <- factor(adsl$TRTA,   levels = c("Placebo", "Xanomeline Low Dose", "Xanomeline High Dose"),   labels = c("Placebo", "Low Dose", "High Dose") )  meta_sl <- meta_adam(   population = adsl,   observation = adsl ) |>   define_plan(plan = plan(     analysis = "base_char", population = "apat",     observation = "apat", parameter = "age;gender;race"   )) |>   define_population(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(SAFFL == "Y"),     var = c("USUBJID", "TRTA", "SAFFL", "AGEGR1", "SEX", "RACE")   ) |>   define_observation(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(SAFFL == "Y"),     var = c("USUBJID", "TRTA", "SAFFL", "AGEGR1", "SEX", "RACE")   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "age",     var = "AGE",     label = "Age (years)",     vargroup = "AGEGR1"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "gender",     var = "SEX",     label = "Gender"   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "race",     var = "RACE",     label = "Race"   ) |>   define_analysis(     name = "base_char",     title = "Participant Baseline Characteristics by Treatment Group",     label = "baseline characteristic table"   ) |>   meta_build()

title: Build an Interactive Baseline Characteristic Table
text: want capitalize first letter “RACE” (e.g., Black african american) character variable, can customize react_base_char function beginning code.
code: # function to capitalize the first letter of a string that has multiple words capitalize_words <- function(x) {   sapply(x, function(word) {     paste0(toupper(substr(word, 1, 1)), tolower(substr(word, 2, nchar(word))))   }) } # 1) In "data_population": extract the RACE values as a character vector race_values_pop <- meta_sl[["data_population"]]$RACE # Use $ to get a vector  # Capitalize the race values meta_sl[["data_population"]]$RACE <- capitalize_words(race_values_pop) # Assign back as a vector  # 2) In "data_observation": extract the RACE values as a character vector race_values_obs <- meta_sl[["data_observation"]]$RACE # Use $ to get a vector  # Capitalize the race values meta_sl[["data_observation"]]$RACE <- capitalize_words(race_values_obs) # Assign back as a vector

title: Treatment Compliance Table
text: function prepare_trt_compliance() written prepare data treatment compliance analysis.function takes four arguments: meta metadata object created metalite contains data ADSL. Analysis, Population, Parameter arguments used subset process meta data. default values, rely meta data object. function assign default value Analysis trt_compliance, Population population value associated trt_compliance analysis meta plan, parameter parameter(s) associated trt_compliance analysis meta$plan. However, user can also manually specify analysis, population, parameter values calling function, want override default values. body function, calls another function prepare_sl_summary meta, analysis, population, parameter arguments. prepare_sl_summary takes meta data, subsets based analysis, population, parameter values, calculates returns summary relevant data. result prepare_sl_summary returned result prepare_trt_compliance. resulting output function prepare_trt_compliance() comprises collection raw datasets analysis reporting. parameter: parameter name n: number participants population resulting dataset contains frequently used statistics, variables indexed according order specified outdata$group. char_n: number participants completed vs completed parameter char_var : name parameter char_prop : proportion subject treatment compliance

title: Subject-Level Analysis Using metalite
text: R package designed analysis & reporting subject baseline characteristics clinical trials. assume ADaM datasets ready analysis leverage metalite data structure define inputs outputs.

title: Subject-Level Analysis Using metalite
text: general workflow : Define metadata information using metalite. prepare_sl_summary() prepares datasets summary baseline characteristics. format_base_char() formats output layout. rtf_base_char() creates TLFs. quick example
code: library("metalite.sl")  meta_sl_example() |>   prepare_sl_summary(     population = "apat",     observation = "apat",     parameter = "age;gender"   ) |>   format_base_char() |>   rtf_base_char(     source = "Source: [CDISCpilot: adam-adsl]",     path_outdata = tempfile(fileext = ".Rdata"),     path_outtable = tempfile(fileext = ".rtf")   )

NA included range, treated -Inf Inf. range defined low <= x < high . duration_category_labels character vector internal labels. Labels displayed duration_category_list values. Must length duration_category_list.

title: metalite.sl 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-05-09

title: metalite.sl 0.1.1
text: react_disposition() now new arguments trtvar, sl_col_selected, sl_col_names, ae_observation. ae_population, ae_col_selected, ae_col_names customize subject lists interactive disposition table (#72, #100). Add vignette interactive disposition table (#77). Add new utility function extract_duration_category_ranges() extract category labels fixed-format strings (#76).

title: metalite.sl 0.1.1
text: Fix bug correctly extract subjects list disposition event react_disposition() (#74, #100). Fix bug correct order first-level header table correctly merge data row dimention differs groups base_char_subgroup() (#80).

title: metalite.sl 0.1.1
text: Remove forestly dependency (#72, #75, #100). Update plotly_exp_duration() change example, default value duration_category_list duration_category_labels, labels drop histograms (#73, #92). Update react_disposition() change default value population sl_parameter according new metadata structure, modify condition drill-list available disposition (#74, #77, #93). Update extend_exp_duration() set default value category_section_label, duration_category_list, duration_category_labels (#76). Update meta_sl_example() add AE data example disposition analysis, remove factorization SEX, change variable name medication disposition (#77, #78). argument controlling display total second-level header moved prepare_base_char_subgroup() format_base_char_subgroup(), renamed display_total(#80). Update format_base_char_subgroup() adjust alignment count values subgroup subject parameter value (#83). Update react_base_char() display error message mismatch display values sl summary table AE table column names subgroup, add space rows labeled “one adverse events,” “adverse events,” AE terms drill-table (#84, #97).
